##I was this close to reporting Dad's factory

WMSYGSDR

Function introduction, each line has the earnest person, again the ordinary person also has the extraordinary story. Huazhong University of Science and Technology Press Official non-fiction story platform, the story of the people will meet here.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
- In the event of an outbreak -

On the seventh day of the first lunar month, it was the day when the blast furnace in my father's factory stopped running. Dad said, out of the factory, the mill like a huge engine, finally stopped running.

”

- In the event of an outbreak -

On the seventh day of the first lunar month, it was the day when the blast furnace in my father's factory stopped running. Dad said, out of the factory, the mill like a huge engine, finally stopped running.

- In the event of an outbreak -

On the seventh day of the first lunar month, it was the day when the blast furnace in my father's factory stopped running. Dad said, out of the factory, the mill like a huge engine, finally stopped running.

”

1

Before you know it, the epidemic has been raging for so long.

When I first heard about the new coronavirus, I complained to the television: "a pneumonia can also cause panic, now the technology is so advanced, it should not spread it. "

Dad also echoed said: "The factory did not notice, I will continue to work tomorrow. "

In those days, the outbreak caused no panic in the family, and everyone went about their business as usual. My mother does the washing and cooking, my father goes to and from work on time, I am at home on holiday, sometimes tidy up some scattered housework.

The eldest brother of Uncle's family hurried back home from Hong Kong before the Spring Festival. On the way he asked in the Wechat Group: Our home there is no back from Wuhan, right? I replied: No, you hurry back home, are waiting for you to eat a reunion dinner.

Big Brother's arrival has added many reunion atmosphere to the home, the mother has made a table the sumptuous New Year's Eve meal. On New Year's Eve, when we went out to pay new year's calls, the view was full of people from the village to pay new year's calls early. Perhaps because there are no confirmed cases in the city, people are more likely to follow the traditions of past festivals than the invisible, invisible ones.

It wasn't until the evening of the first day of the Lunar New Year that the family gathered around the bed to watch TV after dinner. The news from the local TV station shocked the whole family: On that day, 8 new cases of pneumonia were confirmed in this city, of which 2 were in our county.

My father looked at me with a wry smile and said, "well, it's a good one. No one's going out. "

My mother was worried because my father was working the day shift on the second day of the eighth grade. In all, it was his second year on duty in the factory, as if he was working in a steel mill in a county, taking care of car belts and filling a loop cooler with water, there is to go to and from work before the extension of the machine out of the residue clean.

I know what mom is worried about.

Father's factory is very big, at the same time covering pig iron, steel billet, wire and other products production and sales, there are nearly four thousand workers. With the outbreak so intense, what if one of the workers had come into contact with a newly diagnosed case at work?

But a night also did not wait for the notice of the factory shutdown, a family's eyebrows are no longer as usual in the stretch, the taste of the year has been diluted a lot.

Mother picked up the mobile phone and said: "Or, give the leadership to make a call to ask? "

My father stopped her. "Don't bother her so late. We'll see about it tomorrow. "

2

With a sense of unease, my father got up early the next day and went to work in the factory as usual. At the same time, the village issued a closure order, not to allow foreign vehicles in and out, stop all "diplomatic" activities, even to the neighbors were also prohibited.

A few hundred meters away from our home village committee loudspeakers, the Village Party secretary began to pass on the policy, told the villagers that the epidemic spread quickly, must pay attention.

But the more serious the situation, the more I thought of a recurring idea: Dad still works in the factory! STILL IN THE DANGER ZONE!

I sat at home all day, looking out the window, and it was just another day like any other. But my heart kept drumming, I couldn't tell whether it was fear or panic. Under the gray sky, something forbidding seemed to hang over it.

At last the night has come. Dad came home from work, Mom let dad stand in the door, handed him a duster little broom, let him put the dust sweep again and then enter the door. According to the TV, apart from being transmitted by droplets, the virus also sticks to clothing.

"Will you go tomorrow? " Asked his mother.

"Did not say. " The father side is sweeping the ash on the body, the side facial expression is dignified ground answers a way.

According to the day-night shift schedule in Dad's factory, the day shift the day before, the night shift the next day. The factory's no-work schedule meant that he would have to go tomorrow night to the workshop where the workers were gathered, risking exposure to potential infections while worrying both of us at home.

Dad said: "Come back from work today, there have been several villages closed road, home do not let go, at least said just let go. "

After dinner, the family sat down to watch television, and the news showed that the number of confirmed cases nationwide had risen by thousands. My Dad frowned, looked at the silent message window in his cell phone group, and said, "are we going tomorrow night? "

On the morning of the third day of the eighth Lunar Month, I held my father's cell phone and The Hours followed the news of his work group. I'm sure there'll be a notice at the factory before noon. Factory so many people, do not go home to eat in the canteen, then the workers in each workshop will gather into a larger crowd, in case who is infected how to do? ﻿

Until 12:00 noon, I watched the Work Group of those scattered staff to complain about the news, more than a few uneasy heart, it seems that the factory is not going to stop.

Then my father's cell phone rang. It was a workmate from the same workshop. I thought that the work stoppage notice came, excitedly pressed the answer key, but soon, my mood fell to the bottom. On the other end of the phone was the same concern as our family.

"Brother Hai, how can the factory work without any protection? "

The uncle said he was on day shift and had just finished lunch at the factory. At the start of the meal, the dining hall is crowded with workers, and what's more, many workers talk and spit as they eat. He suddenly a little afraid, who knows so many people there is no latent case? Maybe one of them has the virus in them.

I'd been to the cafeteria of my dad's factory, and it was so wide it looked like a huge workshop filled with tables and chairs. In the dining hall, there are six people at a table and three stools in a row. The workers like to chat and eat their meals face to face. I imagine the spectacle of a thousand people eating together, and then I think of the invisible COVID-19, and I am goose bumps.

After listening to his uncle's complaints, his father smiled back at him a few words, advised him not to be afraid, "maybe the factory will stop in the afternoon? "

Dad Sighed as he put the phone down. I thought, he also advised others, his own heart is not sure!

It's been a long afternoon.

Dad had to leave for work at six, and I couldn't wait any longer. After I made up my mind, I secretly used my father's wechat account to give Eite a look at the foreman of the work group. He said that the factory was not safe during the epidemic period. If even one confirmed patient was found, the whole factory would have an outbreak of a mass epidemic. That was the safety of 4,000 people, we should shut it down.

I don't know if I'm directly offended by EITE's behavior or if I'm overstating it. The foreman quickly replied that the factory was already discussing the matter and asked me to wait for further notice. Also remind "father" , said not to send those alarmist words in the group.

Put the phone down. I fell silent. In normal times, I would never say another word and listen to the factory, but now is a special time, I really fear that father was infected.

My father lost his job in 2016 because of a leg problem. Since then, he has been working in a stall in the county town to Nail shoe boards and repair cars. His income is very unstable, and his family is living in poverty. That was also the year my grandfather died after falling down a flight of stairs.

Since then, I have been extremely sensitive to the health of every member of my family because bad things happen so often.

After a long time did not cure the leg to play a year of odd jobs, my father was in the same village under the introduction of an uncle, to the present steel works, a month to take two thousand, seven hundred yuan salary.

I was still in college, and my mother was a housewife, so my father was the sole breadwinner. He's the man of the house, and if anything goes wrong, this family of three is going down with him!

Watching the news updates on the infected, I made up my mind that if I had to report my father's factory, I would have to keep my father safe, or rather, my father and the other workers safe.

3

The next morning, early in the morning, I told my best friend about my dad's factory. Bestie tells me, if really be forced to want to report, can look for the telephone number of administration of Industry and Commerce on the net.

Sure enough, I went online to find the local outbreak reporting clues window, soon saw the administration of Industry and Commerce phone number. I wrote down the number and kept it handy, thinking if the factory didn't make a decision soon, I would report them on the grounds that they were not allowed to produce during the outbreak, regardless of their safety!

Dad here has been off the night shift, I said to report the factory, he said that not good, not want me to do so.

But he couldn't resist me. While he was catching up on sleep, I took his cell phone, opened the chat box of the working group again, and put forward my appeal in the group word for word: I am Li Changhai's daughter, I asked the factory to stop working, until the outbreak is over. As a family member of an employee, I am responsible to my family, as long as I can immediately stop work, you let him go home to continue to set up the stall.

I just want him to be safe.

A large text sent out, received a lot of uncle and aunt's work group like, Everyone said I was dad's little cotton-padded jacket, father and daughter heart. I was a little moved, but those weren't the responses I was looking for. I waited for a long time, but the management of the factory didn't speak up.

I looked at the bureau's tip line, clutching my father's cell phone, and kept saying, "If the leader doesn't reply, I'll call and report you. "

A few hours later, my father woke up to see the news in the group, a bit I can not help laughing at me and said: "who cares about you this little girl. "

I stared at the strange phone number and said nothing. I know it's hard to talk to my own people, but I really don't have any other choice but to call the police.

In order not to miss the news in the group, I always hold my father's cell phone. Toward two in the afternoon, the group finally sent out a notification for all of EITE, which I quickly opened as a promise.

It said that when the outbreak first spread, factory executives had already held a meeting and decided to shut down as soon as possible, but the rolling mill shut down not as quickly as pulling the power switch, because the blast furnace was still on duty, and the factory was still undertaking the task of supplying heat and thermal power by spare time, even halting production takes a few days off, so the factory has been coordinating everything.

The factory promised to ensure the safety of every employee before the shutdown. The factory has contacted the city and county centers for Disease Control and Prevention. There will be people at the factory gate to take body temperature and distribute special N95 anti-virus masks. Moreover, the canteen of the factory will no longer allow group meals, and the workshop will be regularly disinfected every day, please rest assured the families.

A commitment, not a lot of words, but for me, it is reassuring enough. I know that behind these words, is not only the responsibility of the factory, but also in the group of more than 40 workers behind the families of worried eyes.

Screenshot of the message to eliminate possible patients

With the promise of the factory, my father told me that the factory is responsible for every inspection. Anyone who finds a headache or fever will be sent to a designated hospital for examination immediately.

Fortunately, before the shutdown, not a single case was reported in the factory.

4

On those days, my father rode his motorcycle to and from work every day. It was a long drive, about an hour's drive, and he had to pass through several villages for body temperature and identity checks.

To Keep Dad away from the air and the crowds, she made him wear two masks a day, and then put on a hat and gloves and wrap him up tight before letting him go out.

He usually came home from work, and did not wait for my mother and I asked him to report his own "normal temperature, the local people. ". My mother and I would sometimes laugh at him, but then added, "we can't afford to be careless. "

Yeah, well, despite the factory's commitment, the containment measures have been implemented. But as the child of an employee, I am constantly worried about my father, who wanders through retreats and crowds.

Knowing my fears, my friend reassured me: "In this particular time, someone has to make a sacrifice. In addition to the doctors, nurses, soldiers, police officers, volunteers who fought the COVID-19 on the Wuhan Front Line, there are thousands of other workers like your father who are still at work. You have to understand your father, and you have to understand the decisions that the factory makes, and once all the workers stop working immediately, the world is really going to hell."

﻿

On the fifth day, my father came back from work and told me that the workers in the working group had gone on strike for the right reasons: The village was sealed up and could not get out. After the foreman spoke to the management, the management asked to count the number of villages where going out was strictly prohibited, and to keep as many employees as possible to the last minute.

After compiling the data, the factory arranged ideological work from person to person, village to village, telling Party members and cadres to return to the place where the company could issue certificates to ensure the absolute safety of employees when they returned to the village. What's more, the factory's previously rented rooms are now free for workers who don't want to go home after work, reducing their exposure on the road.

Wave after wave of employees left the factory and went home on leave. Because no one knows how long the outbreak will last, everyone can only stay at home, not go anywhere. This, I think, is the greatest contribution that we ordinary people can make to the cause of fighting the epidemic.

I stayed at home nothing to do, spare time with my mother to learn a few new dishes. When my father gets off work, he will find that there is a dish on the table that I cooked with my own hands, and put it in his mouth to taste.

I was happy to hear that. Because Dad as the last group of workers stuck in the factory, finally can go home for a good year.

(father in name only)

-END-

Author | hometown, Chang'an, young author.

Caption | still of sunshine

Huazhong University of Science and Technology Press
